extendedIngredients.name: egg
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 Egg, room temperature and lightly beaten

extendedIngredients.name: gluten-free flour
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups flour (I used King Arthur's Gluten-Free Flour blend; can use all purpose flour if not making them gluten-free)
metaInformation: (I used King Arthur's Flour blend; can use all purpose flour if not making them )

recipes.title: Chewy Ginger Snaps

winePairing.pairingText: Cream Sherry, Madeira, and Prosecco are my top picks for Cookies. Sweet bubbly Prosecco doesn't overwhelm simple sugar or shortbread cookies, a sweet cream sherry complements spiced cookies, and madeira's nutty notes match cookies with nuts perfectly. You could try NV Solera Cream Sherry. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: In a medium mixing bowl, stir together baking powder, flour, cloves, ginger, cinnamon and salt.   Set aside. In a second mixing bowl, with a mixer cream the softened butter.  Add the sugar and beat to fully combine.Add the molasses and egg; beat on low to combine (do not over mix).Slowly add the dry mixture to the wet mixture, beating on low speed, adding a small amount and allowing it to incorporate before adding more.Stir in crystallized ginger.Cover and chill in the refrigerator for 1-2 hours, or until dough is fully chilled and stiff.Ten minutes before the hour chilling time is done, preheat the oven to 375 degrees.Place enough sugar to roll the dough in a small bowl.  Roll the dough into 1 inch balls.    Place in sugar and roll the dough ball to fully cover.Place dough balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper allowing 2 inch spacing between them.  Bake for 8-10 minutes.  Remove from oven.Allow cookies to sit on the baking sheet for 5 minutes then transfer to a cooling rack to cool for 10 minutes or until set.

steps.step: In a medium mixing bowl, stir together baking powder, flour, cloves, ginger, cinnamon and salt.   Set aside. In a second mixing bowl, with a mixer cream the softened butter.
Add the sugar and beat to fully combine.

Add the molasses and egg; beat on low to combine (do not over mix).Slowly add the dry mixture to the wet mixture, beating on low speed, adding a small amount and allowing it to incorporate before adding more.Stir in crystallized ginger.Cover and chill in the refrigerator for 1-2 hours, or until dough is fully chilled and stiff.Ten minutes before the hour chilling time is done, preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
Place enough sugar to roll the dough in a small bowl.
Roll the dough into 1 inch balls.
Place in sugar and roll the dough ball to fully cover.
Place dough balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper allowing 2 inch spacing between them.
Remove from oven.Allow cookies to sit on the baking sheet for 5 minutes then transfer to a cooling rack to cool for 10 minutes or until set.
